messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: 27 July 2023, Detective Rawlins and Sergeant Mitchell arrived at Sunset Park, 72 Elmwood Drive, near the pond area by about 7:15 PM. Weather overcast and slightly drizzling.  When they reached, Technician Gary Stone from Central Sheriff's Crime Scene Division: was already there. Photos of the park bench and surrounding area were taken by Technician Stone. Stone also lifted an unknown set of footprints from the muddy ground beside the bench.  Several park goers nearby during alleged battery. One Mr. Arnold Grayson, described a medium-built female suspect, approximately 5'5, with a red baseball cap. Suspect seen leaving park hurriedly, headed west.  On 29 July 2023, call received by Detective Rawlins from Officer Lucy O'Neal who encountered a female matching suspect's description in Westside Alley, having a red baseball cap in her bag.  30 July 2023, a.m. hours, Detective Rawlins conducted line-up for Watkins at the Criminal Investigations Division. Mrs. Watkins shown a line-up of six grayscale photos of female subjects, with one being Ms. Brenda McAdams. Watkins hesitated, but later positively indicated McAdams as the aggressor.  The line-up was clicked by Technician Stone around: 9:30 AM, the date : Attorney Mark Owens was present but not actively participating during this.  Attached to this report are the witness report from Grayson, the line-up log, and a TENATIVE identification form for McAdams, which should be viewed as integral to this report.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Detective Rawlins Officer Context: On 27 July 2023, Detective Rawlins and Sergeant Mitchell arrived at Sunset Park, 72 Elmwood Drive, near the pond area by about 7:15 PM. On 29 July 2023, a call was received by Detective Rawlins from Officer Lucy O'Neal who encountered a female matching the suspect's description in Westside Alley. On 30 July 2023, in the morning hours, Detective Rawlins conducted a line-up for Watkins at the Criminal Investigations Division. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: Sergeant Mitchell Officer Context: On 27 July 2023, Detective Rawlins and Sergeant Mitchell arrived at Sunset Park, 72 Elmwood Drive, near the pond area by about 7:15 PM. Officer Role: Sergeant  Officer Name: Technician Gary Stone Officer Context: When they arrived, Technician Gary Stone from the Central Sheriff's Crime Scene Division was already there. Photos of the park bench and surrounding area were taken by Technician Stone. Stone also lifted an unknown set of footprints from the muddy ground beside the bench. The line-up was clicked by Technician Stone around 9:30 AM. Officer Role: Technician  Officer Name: Officer Lucy O'Neal Officer Context: On 29 July 2023, a call was received by Detective Rawlins from Officer Lucy O'Neal who encountered a female matching the suspect's description in Westside Alley, having a red baseball cap in her bag. Officer Role: Officer
